noun.description: Simultaneous performance of action or utterance of speech.
examples: “Yes, sir,” said the girls in unison
synonyms: at one and the same time

noun.description: Coincidence in pitch of sounds or notes.
examples: the flutes play in unison with the violas

origin: Late Middle English (in unison (sense 2 of the noun)): from Old French, or from late Latin unisonus, from Latin uni- one + sonus sound.
